name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__LIST_MESSAGES
description: List email messages from the user's inbox.

$top.description: Limits the number of items returned from a collection

$skip.description: Skips items in a result set. Also used by some APIs to implement paging and can be used with $top to manually page results

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__LIST_MESSAGES_IN_FOLDER
description: Get all messages in a specified mail folder. Supports filtering, pagination, and sorting using OData query parameters. This allows you to retrieve messages from any specific folder in the mailbox.

folder_id.description: The unique identifier of the mail folder, or a well-known folder name (e.g., 'inbox', 'drafts', 'sentitems')

query.description: Query parameters for filtering and customizing the message list

$select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include (e.g., 'id,subject,sender,receivedDateTime')

$filter.description: Filter expression to limit messages (e.g., 'hasAttachments eq true', 'from/emailAddress/address eq "example@domain.com"')

$orderby.description: Property to sort by with direction (e.g., 'receivedDateTime desc', 'subject asc')

$top.description: Maximum number of messages to return (default 10, max 1000)

$skip.description: Number of messages to skip for pagination

$search.description: Search query string to find messages containing specific text

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__LIST_MAIL_FOLDERS
description: Get the mail folder collection directly under the root folder of the signed-in user. Includes mail search folders and can optionally include hidden folders.

query.description: Query parameters for customizing the folder list

includeHiddenFolders.description: Include hidden folders in the response (folders where isHidden property is true)

$top.description: Limits the number of folders returned from a collection

$skip.description: Skips folders in a result set

$filter.description: OData filter expression to filter folders

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__GET_MAIL_FOLDER
description: Retrieve the properties and relationships of a specific mail folder object by its ID. Returns detailed folder information including permissions and relationships.

folder_id.description: The unique identifier of the mail folder to retrieve

query.description: Query parameters for customizing the folder details

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__UPDATE_MAIL_FOLDER
description: Update the properties of a mail folder object. Currently supports updating the display name of the folder. This allows you to rename folders for better organization.

folder_id.description: The unique identifier of the mail folder to update

body.description: The mail folder properties to update

displayName.description: The new display name for the mail folder. This will be the name shown in the user's mailbox.

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__LIST_CHILD_FOLDERS
description: Get the collection of child folders under a specified mail folder. By default, hidden folders are excluded unless explicitly requested. Supports OData query parameters for filtering and customization.

folder_id.description: The unique identifier of the parent mail folder whose child folders to retrieve

query.description: Query parameters for customizing the child folder list

includeHiddenFolders.description: Whether to include hidden child folders in the response. Default is false.

$select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response (e.g., 'id,displayName,totalItemCount')

$filter.description: Filter expression to limit the child folders returned (e.g., 'totalItemCount gt 0')

$orderby.description: Property to sort the child folders by, optionally with 'asc' or 'desc' (e.g., 'displayName asc')

$top.description: Maximum number of child folders to return

$skip.description: Number of child folders to skip (for pagination)

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__CREATE_MESSAGE_IN_FOLDER
description: Create a new message directly in a specific mail folder. This creates an actual message in the folder, not a draft. The message will appear in the specified folder immediately.

folder_id.description: The unique identifier of the mail folder where the message will be created

subject.description: The subject line of the message

contentType.description: The content type of the body. Either 'text' or 'html'

content.description: The content of the message body

toRecipients.description: The recipients in the To field

name.description: The display name of the recipient

ccRecipients.description: The recipients in the CC field

name.description: The display name of the recipient

bccRecipients.description: The recipients in the BCC field

name.description: The display name of the recipient

importance.description: The importance of the message. Values: low, normal, high

isRead.description: Indicates whether the message has been read

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__CREATE_MAIL_FOLDER
description: Create a new mail folder in the root folder of the user's mailbox. You can set the folder name and whether it should be hidden. Hidden folders cannot be unhidden later.

body.description: The mail folder properties to create

displayName.description: The display name of the new folder. This is the name that will appear in the user's mailbox.

isHidden.description: Indicates whether the new folder should be hidden. Default is false. Once set to true, this property cannot be changed later.

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__CREATE_CHILD_FOLDER
description: Create a new child mail folder under a specific parent folder. You can set the folder name and whether it should be hidden. Hidden folders cannot be unhidden later. This is useful for organizing emails in a hierarchical structure.

folder_id.description: The unique identifier of the parent mail folder under which to create the child folder

body.description: The child folder properties to create

displayName.description: The display name of the new child folder. This is the name that will appear in the user's mailbox under the parent folder.

isHidden.description: Indicates whether the new child folder should be hidden. Default is false. Once set to true, this property cannot be changed later.

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__GET_MESSAGE
description: Get a specific email message by its ID with detailed information including sender, recipients, subject, body, and attachments.

message_id.description: The unique identifier of the message to retrieve

query.description: Query parameters for customizing the response

$select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response (e.g., 'subject,sender,receivedDateTime')

$expand.description: Comma-separated list of relationships to expand (e.g., 'attachments')

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__DELETE_MESSAGE
description: Delete a specific email message by its ID. This operation moves the message to the Deleted Items folder.

message_id.description: The unique identifier of the message to delete

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__PERMANENT_DELETE
description: Permanently delete a message and place it in the purges folder in the dumpster. Unlike regular delete, this cannot be recovered by email clients and items are permanently deleted after a set period.

message_id.description: The unique identifier of the message to permanently delete

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__COPY_MESSAGE
description: Copy a message to a folder within the user's mailbox. You can specify a destination folder ID or use well-known folder names like 'inbox', 'drafts', 'sentitems', 'deleteditems'.

message_id.description: The unique identifier of the message to copy

destinationId.description: The destination folder ID, or a well-known folder name (e.g., 'inbox', 'drafts', 'sentitems', 'deleteditems', 'archive', 'junkfolder')

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__CREATE_FORWARD
description: Create a draft to forward an existing message. You can optionally add a comment and specify recipients. The draft can be updated later or sent in a subsequent operation.

message_id.description: The unique identifier of the message to forward

body.description: Optional parameters for the forward draft

comment.description: A comment to include with the forward (alternative to message body)

toRecipients.description: The list of recipients to forward the message to

address.description: The email address of the recipient

name.description: The display name of the recipient

message.description: Message properties for the forward draft

body.description: The body content of the forward message

contentType.description: The content type of the message body

content.description: The actual content of the message body

toRecipients.description: The list of recipients (alternative to top-level toRecipients)

address.description: The email address of the recipient

name.description: The display name of the recipient

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__CREATE_REPLY
description: Create a draft reply to an existing message. The reply will automatically include the original sender as the recipient and reference the original message.

message_id.description: The unique identifier of the message to reply to

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__CREATE_REPLY_ALL
description: Create a draft to reply to the sender and all recipients of a message. The reply will automatically include all original recipients (To, CC) and follow proper reply-to logic.

message_id.description: The unique identifier of the message to reply to all recipients

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__FORWARD
description: Forward a message immediately (not as draft). The message will be sent right away and saved in the Sent Items folder. You can add a comment and specify recipients.

message_id.description: The unique identifier of the message to forward

body.description: The request body for forwarding the message

comment.description: A comment to include with the forwarded message. Cannot be used together with message.body property.

toRecipients.description: The recipients for the forwarded message. Cannot be used together with message.toRecipients property.

name.description: The display name for the email address

message.description: Alternative way to specify message properties

body.description: The body of the forwarded message. Cannot be used together with comment parameter.

contentType.description: The content type of the body

toRecipients.description: Recipients in message format. Cannot be used together with toRecipients parameter.

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__REPLY
description: Reply to the sender of a message immediately (not as draft). The reply will be sent right away and saved in the Sent Items folder. You can add a comment or custom body.

message_id.description: The unique identifier of the message to reply to

body.description: The request body for the reply

comment.description: A comment to include with the reply. Cannot be used together with message.body property.

message.description: Alternative way to specify message properties

body.description: The body of the reply message. Cannot be used together with comment parameter.

contentType.description: The content type of the body

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__REPLY_ALL
description: Reply to all recipients of a message immediately (not as draft). The reply will be sent right away to all original recipients and saved in the Sent Items folder. You can add a comment or custom body.

message_id.description: The unique identifier of the message to reply all to

body.description: The request body for the reply all

comment.description: A comment to include with the reply all. Cannot be used together with message.body property.

message.description: Alternative way to specify message properties

body.description: The body of the reply all message. Cannot be used together with comment parameter.

contentType.description: The content type of the body

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__SEND
description: Send an existing draft message. The draft can be a new message draft, reply draft, reply-all draft, or forward draft. This saves the message in the Sent Items folder.

message_id.description: The unique identifier of the draft message to send

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__CREATE_DRAFT_MESSAGE
description: Create a draft of a new message in JSON format. By default, this operation saves the draft in the Drafts folder. You can update the draft later to add content or change properties, or send it in a subsequent operation.

body.description: The message properties for creating a draft email

importance.description: The importance level of the message

body.description: The body content of the message

contentType.description: The content type of the message body

content.description: The actual content of the message body

toRecipients.description: The list of recipients to send the message to

address.description: The email address of the recipient

name.description: The display name of the recipient

address.description: The email address of the CC recipient

name.description: The display name of the CC recipient

address.description: The email address of the BCC recipient

name.description: The display name of the BCC recipient

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__DELTA_MAIL_FOLDERS
description: Get incremental changes (added, deleted, or updated) in mail folders since the last delta query. This allows efficient synchronization by tracking only changes rather than fetching all folders every time. Use deltatoken for completed rounds and skiptoken for pagination.

query.description: Query parameters for delta tracking and customization

$deltatoken.description: State token from the @odata.deltaLink URL of the previous delta call, indicating completion of a change tracking round. Use this to start the next round of change tracking.

$skiptoken.description: State token from the @odata.nextLink URL of the previous delta call, indicating there are more changes to be tracked in the same round.

$select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response for performance optimization (e.g., 'id,displayName,parentFolderId'). The 'id' property is always returned.

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__COPY_MAIL_FOLDER
description: Copy a mail folder and its contents to another mail folder. You can specify a destination folder ID or use well-known folder names like 'inbox', 'drafts', 'sentitems', 'deleteditems'. The entire folder structure and contents will be duplicated.

folder_id.description: The unique identifier of the mail folder to copy

destinationId.description: The destination folder ID, or a well-known folder name (e.g., 'inbox', 'drafts', 'sentitems', 'deleteditems', 'archive', 'junkfolder')

name: MICROSOFT_OUTLOOK__DELETE_MAIL_FOLDER
description: Delete a mail folder by its ID. The folder can be a mailSearchFolder. You can specify a mail folder by its folder ID, or by its well-known folder name. Note: You may not be able to delete items in the recoverable items deletions folder.

folder_id.description: The unique identifier of the mail folder to delete, or a well-known folder name
